name: mailgun
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Mailgun resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`mailgun` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/wgebis/terraform-provider-mailgun).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Mailgun resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/wgebis/terraform-provider-mailgun)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-mailgun` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-mailgun/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-mailgun` repo](https://github.com/wgebis/terraform-provider-mailgun/issues).

> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,

name.description: The domain to add to Mailgun
The domain to add to Mailgun

provider.description:
The provider type for the mailgun package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

clickTracking.description: (Enum: `yes` or `no`) The click tracking settings for the domain. Default: `no`

dkimKeySize.description: The length of your domain’s generated DKIM key. Default value is `1024`.

dkimSelector.description: The name of your DKIM selector if you want to specify it whereas MailGun will make it's own choice.

forceDkimAuthority.description: If set to true, the domain will be the DKIM authority for itself even if the root domain is registered on the same mailgun account. If set to false, the domain will have the same DKIM authority as the root domain registered on the same mailgun account. The default is `false`.

name.description: The domain to add to Mailgun

openTracking.description: (Enum: `yes` or `no`) The open tracking settings for the domain. Default: `no`

receivingRecords.description: A list of DNS records for receiving validation.  **Deprecated** Use `receiving_records_set` instead.

receivingRecordsSets.description: A set of DNS records for receiving validation.

region.description: The region where domain will be created. Default value is `us`.

sendingRecords.description: A list of DNS records for sending validation. **Deprecated** Use `sending_records_set` instead.

sendingRecordsSets.description: A set of DNS records for sending validation.

smtpLogin.description: The login email for the SMTP server.

spamAction.description:
`disabled` or `tag` Disable, no spam
filtering will occur for inbound messages. Tag, messages
will be tagged with a spam header. Default value is `disabled`.

webScheme.description: (`http` or `https`) The tracking web scheme. Default: `http`

wildcard.description:
Boolean that determines whether
the domain will accept email for sub-domains.

forceDkimAuthority.description: If set to true, the domain will be the DKIM authority for itself even if the root domain is registered on the same mailgun account. If set to false, the domain will have the same DKIM authority as the root domain registered on the same mailgun account. The default is `false`.
